snippet: Fearing their accounts will be exposed, interviewees for an oral history project on the Troubles in Northern Ireland have sought the return of tapes and transcripts.
abstract: Boston College officials agree to relinquish secret interviews with former Irish paramilitaries if interviewees, who spoke years ago under guarantee of confidentiality, request documents; several have already sought transcripts out of fear they will be exposed, following arrest of Sinn Fein president Gerry Adams in connection with 1972 abduction and murder based on comments he made during interviews for college's oral history project.
lead_paragraph: Fearing their accounts will be exposed, interviewees for an oral history project on the Troubles in Northern Ireland have sought the return of tapes and transcripts.

headline.main: Boston College Says It Will Return Interviews About Northern Ireland
headline.print_headline: College Says It Will Return Interviews About Ulster
